channel.title: [EXPERIENCED CODERS] - SendFrame164
channel.description:
I've been recently making a quest, and when I have NPC Dialogues, I know there are a few codes to show the face of the NPC Talking to, to make it a select option: All using sendFrame164
Example: [code] sendFrame164(-ID HERE-); [/code]
This is used when I talk to NPCs. What is the "ID" for sendFrame164 that shows the player talking to the NPC, sort of how it is in RuneScape?
4900 Shows the NPC Talking 2459 Makes it "Select an Option" ???? Shows the Player Talking
So does anybody know what the ???? or the ID is for sendFrame164 that shows the player talking to the npc?
Thanks in advance -TeleNubby

item.title: [EXPERIENCED CODERS] - SendFrame164
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

Your talking back involves an Option of Yes/No. Not just a normal conversation. What I’m going for is a normal conversation, and my player head appearing instead of the NPC’s.

And read a few posts above. I got it work, but it only works on the MoparScape client. When I use it on my client, I get the error:

Error: T2 - 200,126,134 - 4,3003,3382 - 2,103,3-50,

Read full topic

item.title: [EXPERIENCED CODERS] - SendFrame164
item.dc:creator: @bakatool bakatool
item.description:
@bakatool wrote:

talking back to npc is not that hard

Here is a dark mage in my server If you click on him he asks you 'Do you want to be converted?

        c.sendFrame126(c.GetNpcName(c.NpcTalkTo), 4902);
        c.sendFrame126("", 4903);
        c.sendFrame126("Hello...are you wishing to be converted?", 4904);
        c.sendFrame126("", 4905);
        c.sendFrame126("", 4906);
        c.sendFrame75(c.NpcTalkTo, 4901);
        c.sendFrame164(4900);
        c.NpcDialogueSend = true;
        break;

You answer with Of course or Nope (anicant magicks)

      case 1002:
        c.sendFrame171(1, 2465);
        c.sendFrame171(0, 2468);
        c.sendFrame126("Select an Option", 2460);
        c.sendFrame126("Of course.", 2461);
        c.sendFrame126("Nope.", 2462);
        c.sendFrame164(2459);
        c.NpcDialogueSend = true;
        break;

now your handling code is this… for case 1002…

        }else if(c.NpcDialogue == 1002) { // Dark Mage
          c.NpcDialogue = 0;
          c.NpcDialogueSend = false;
          c.stillgfx(435, c.absY, c.absX);
          c.RemoveAllWindows();
          if(c.ancients == 1) {
            c.setSidebarInterface(6, 1151); //magic tab(ancient = 12855);
            c.ancients = 0;
            c.sendMessage("The dark mage converts back to normal magic!");
          } else {
            c.setSidebarInterface(6, 12855); //magic tab(ancient = 12855);
            c.ancients = 1;
            c.sendMessage("The dark mage converts you to ancient magicks!");
          }

Read full topic

         case 7001: 
		sendFrame200(615, 974);
		sendFrame126(playerName, 975);
		sendFrame126("SIR, YES SIR", 977);
		sendFrame185(974);
		sendFrame164(973);
		NpcDialogueSend = true;
		break;

you’d rather wanna use this code instead.[/quote]

Hmm, that’s odd. That piece of code works on the MoparScape client, but when I use my client, it crashes and I get this error:

Error: T2 - 200,126,134 - 4,3003,3382 - 2,103,3-50,

item.title: [EXPERIENCED CODERS] - SendFrame164
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

[quote=“AD LVL 7, post:10, topic:119629”]you don’t use that frame for a player

sendFrame164(973);

that’s the sendframe for player talks[/quote]
Thanks :)[br][size=1]Posted on: July 04, 2007, 01:58:15 PM[/size][hr]EDIT: It doesnt work.

Here’s my code:

         case 7001:
            sendFrame126(""+playerName+"", 4902);
            sendFrame126("", 4903);
            sendFrame126("SIR, YES SIR!", 4904);
            sendFrame126("", 4905);
            sendFrame126("", 4906);
            sendFrame75(NpcTalkTo, 4901);
            sendFrame164(973); //This is the player talking 'picture' ?
            NpcDialogueSend = true;
            break;

That doesnt work. I also tried this:

         case 7001: 
		sendFrame200(615, 974);
		sendFrame126(playerName, 975);
		sendFrame126("SIR, YES SIR!", 976);
		sendFrame126("", 977);
		sendFrame185(974);
		sendFrame164(973);
		NpcDialogueSend = true;
		break;

Neither work.

Read full topic
